page.title: 16Purley Hospital
page.content: Purley hospital was originally built in 1909 but the new building called the Memorial Hospital was built during the Second World War in 1940. Nowadays it is a unit caring mainly for the elderly although some of the 57 beds are for medical cases. The wards are small with 8 or 10 beds in each and a few single rooms. The atmosphere is homely and often a husband or wife of an elderly patient will be allowed to stay in the hospital even if he or she is not ill, just to keep each other company. The hospital runs many clinics including chest, chiropody and diabetic but it no longer carries out surgical operations. It has a part-time casualty department but does not run its own ambulances. It is run by the National Health Service.
